<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 178, 292]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0625/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 299, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Theory (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
February/March 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 730, 651]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
A boat crosses a river. The boat points at right angles to the river bank and it travels at a speed of \(3.5 \text{m / s}\) relative to the water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
A river current acts at right angles to the direction the boat points. The river current has a speed of \(2.5 \text{m / s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 920, 196]]<|/det|>
By drawing a scale diagram or by calculation, determine the speed and direction of the boat relative to the river bank.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[512, 533, 917, 551]]<|/det|>
<form>speed = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[290, 564, 920, 581]]<|/det|>
direction relative to the river bank = ....................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 490, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 335, 484, 354]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 489, 902, 508]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 427, 918, 460]]<|/det|>
Deuterium is an isotope of hydrogen (H) with 1 proton and 1 neutron. Nuclear fusion occurs when two nuclei of deuterium combine. An isotope of helium (He) and a neutron are formed.
